main.name: Connor Shannon
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
bio: I’m interested in bridging the gap between technical, research, and design approaches to create impactful products and experiences that encourage collaboration and strengthen communities. I’m interested in working across boundaries and disciplines to best leverage everyone’s unique skill-set and expertise.

I graduated in Biomedical Engineering and worked on new medical device development for two years before deciding to pursue a Master of Human-Computer Interaction at Carnegie Mellon University in 2019.

I believe in the creative potential of individuals and communities to solve their own problems and hope to develop technology to help them realize this potential. I’m a ‘systems thinker’ and believe that in order to solve the right problems, we need to understand the systems(relationships, habits, environments) that lead to problematic outcomes, then work to design better ones.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
